msContents.summary: Fragments of three poorly preserved documents that were found close together. The three documents are put together from ﬁve roll-pieces. There are certain similarities in the contents of all the three papyri. They all seem to deal with taxes and landed property.

msItemStruct.note: Written transversa charta across the fibers, consists of roll-pieces α15A (left) and α13A (right), which can be securely joined. The end, featuring a bottom margin of up to 6.5 cm, is the best-preserved part of the document. In the beginning, there is an extensive empty space, probably representing the top margin. It must originally have measured at least 18.4 cm, approximately one fourth of the document’s total length, ca. 73 cm, including the gaps, but excluding fragments α15 A1–6, which appear to come from before the top margin; they may simply be misplaced, possibly belonging in 81B.
